intro: Haplolobus floribundus var. hirsutus, commonly known as the hairy haplolobus, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, showy flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sunlight. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
